subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: The vice president of A.C. Milan, Adriano Galliani, said the club’s offer of $3 million for David Beckham was the market rate and it would not be increased. The Los Angeles Galaxy recently turned down the offer, calling it “ridiculous.” The Italian newspaper La Gazzetta dello Sport reported Saturday that Galliani said Milan would not make another offer. Beckham, who is on loan to Milan until March 8, has a clause in his Galaxy contract that allows him to leave at the end of the 2009 season.
